mdRecord.dcterms:description: Judson Memorial Church and Judson Hall and Tower were built in 1892 on the designs of McKim, Mead & White. The style of the church is Lombardo-Romanesque. When officially completed in 1893, primary architect Stanford White had constructed the 102 foot long church, and a 165 foot high campanile tower. The adjacent Hall, however, predates the church, having been built in 1877, and was designed by John G. Prague. [work]
